com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.annotations

Annotation Type Asynchronous


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=SOURCE)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Asynchronous
    This annotation is used to signal, that the annotated method is executing some procedure within another Thread.

    This should be a sign for anyone, to ensure thread safety

    It is further recommended to return any kind of synchronization-mechanism (like Awaiting) but it is certainly not required.

    Outside of NetCom2's internal Modules, this Annotation is a signal, that you will be restricted to asynchronous behaviour if you call this Method. Therefore you may not be able to work synchronously or in a procedural style.

    This Annotation is only used, if the method is directly extracting something into another thread. If (for example) Connection#write is called, this is not reason to apply this annotation. That is because, whether or not the Connection extracts something into another Thread, depends on the implementation.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
